info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:55PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington and southwestern Iron Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beaver Dam State Park, or near Beaver Dam, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beaver Dam and Goldstrike. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
